00062 class SIM_API cDisplayString
00063 {
00064   private:
00065     enum { MAXARGS = 16 };  // maximum number of arguments per tag
00066 
00067     // holds one tag
00068     struct Tag {
00069        char *name;
00070        int numargs;
00071        char *args[MAXARGS];
00072        Tag() {name=NULL; numargs=0;}
00073     };
00074 
00075     char *buffer;       // holds pieces of display string (sliced with zeroes)
00076     char *bufferend;    // points to last byte of buffer allocated
00077     Tag *tags;          // table of tags
00078     int numtags;        // number of tags
00079 
00080     mutable char *dispstr; // cached copy of assembled display string
00081     mutable bool needsassemble; // if dispstr is up-to-date
00082 
00083     // needed to notify Envir
00084     cComponent *object;     // a cModule or cChannel pointer
00085 
00086   private:
00087     // helper functions
00088     void parse();
00089     void assemble() const;
00090     int gettagindex(const char *tagname) const;
00091     void cleartags();
00092     bool isinbuffer(char *s) const {return s>=buffer && s<=bufferend;}
00093     static void strcatescaped(char *d, const char *s);
00094 
00095   private:
00096     // internal: called when the stored display string changes, and notifies Envir in turn.
00097     void notify();
00098 
00099   public:
00100     // internal:
00101     void setHostObject(cComponent *o) {object=o;}
00102     void dump() const;
00103 
00104   public:
00107 
00111     cDisplayString();
00112 
00116     cDisplayString(const char *dispstr);
00117 
00121     cDisplayString(const cDisplayString& ds);
00122 
00126     ~cDisplayString();
00128 
00134     cDisplayString& operator=(const cDisplayString& ds) {parse(ds.str()); return *this;}
00135 
00139     cDisplayString& operator=(const char *s)  {parse(s); return *this;}
00140 
00144     operator const char *() const  {return str();}
00146 
00149 
00153     const char *str() const;
00154 
00158     void set(const char *displaystr)  {parse(displaystr);}
00159 
00164     void parse(const char *displaystr);
00165 
00170     void updateWith(const cDisplayString& ds);
00171 
00176     void updateWith(const char *s);
00178 
00181 
00185     bool containsTag(const char *tagname) const;
00186 
00194     int getNumArgs(const char *tagname) const;
00195 
00201     const char *getTagArg(const char *tagname, int index) const;
00202 
00212     bool setTagArg(const char *tagname, int index, const char *value);
00213 
00218     bool setTagArg(const char *tagname, int index, long value);
00219 
00225     bool removeTag(const char *tagname);
00227 
00230 
00235     int getNumTags() const;
00236 
00241     const char *getTagName(int tagindex) const;
00242 
00250     int getNumArgs(int tagindex) const;
00251 
00257     const char *getTagArg(int tagindex, int index) const;
00258 
00268     bool setTagArg(int tagindex, int index, const char *value);
00269 
00277     int insertTag(const char *tagname, int atindex=0);
00278 
00284     bool removeTag(int tagindex);
00286 };
